intro: Rhus bofillii, commonly known as the Mexican sumac, is a deciduous shrub native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Anacardiaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like poison ivy and mango. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves, which are typically arranged in pairs along the stems. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are followed by red, fuzzy fruits that mature in the fall. Rhus bofillii is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
